paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: patients enrolled in the Cardiac Amyloidosis Registry Study (CARS)

functional_data.summary: The p.V142I mutation is associated with ATTR cardiac amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The study suggests familial patterns but does not provide specific segregation data.
variants.population_frequency: 68% of patients with ATTR cardiac amyloidosis had this mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The prevalence of the p.V142I mutation is significant in the context of ATTR cardiac amyloidosis.
key_quotes: 71% of them having the wild-type and 68% with the p.V142I mutation.

patients.demographics: patients with ATTRv mutations in Bologna, Italy

functional_data.summary: The Ile68Leu variant is one of the most prevalent mutations associated with ATTRv.

variants.segregation_data: The study indicates familial patterns but does not provide specific segregation data.
variants.population_frequency: 41.8% of patients with ATTRv mutations had this variant.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is significant in the context of familial amyloidosis.
key_quotes: TTR gene variants were identified in the study, with the most prevalent ones being Ile68Leu (41.8%).

patients.demographics: patients with ATTRv mutations in Bologna, Italy

functional_data.summary: The Glu89Gln variant is one of the notable mutations associated with ATTRv.

variants.segregation_data: The study indicates familial patterns but does not provide specific segregation data.
variants.population_frequency: 10% of patients with ATTRv mutations had this variant.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is significant in the context of familial amyloidosis.
key_quotes: TTR gene variants were identified in the study, with the most prevalent ones being Glu89Gln (10%).

patients.demographics: patients with ATTRv mutations in Bologna, Italy

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is one of the most common mutations associated with ATTRv.

variants.segregation_data: The study indicates familial patterns but does not provide specific segregation data.
variants.population_frequency: 19% of patients with ATTRv mutations had this variant.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is significant in the context of familial amyloidosis.
key_quotes: TTR gene variants were identified in the study, with the most prevalent ones being Val30Met (19%).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted with associated penetrance data.
